top_categories.workout_context: 60ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo's Gravel roads, Forest service roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo. Train it until it feels boring.
At Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
75 miles on forest service roads and gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
When someone attacks on forest service roads and gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Varied gradients on forest service roads and gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on forest service roads and gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,500ft of climbing on forest service roads and gravel does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Cowichan Crusher Gravel Fondo requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on forest service roads and gravel to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, forest service roads, lake scenery.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of forest service roads and gravel in Lake Cowichan, British Columbia.
